Component ‘officelink’¶

The PowerScript-class OfficeLinkComponent in $(CADDOK_MODULE)/component.py exists in the form of a skeleton, which can be overwritten and adapted according to customer requirements. The class provides an entry point (on_document_created) in order to complete the actual archiving process with custom reworking steps. This component gets called, provided it is activated, from the Microsoft Outlook integration directly after a successful archiving of an element (attachment or mail) as a document.

Note

By default the method on_document_created doesn’t get called. This means that an active call with the values document|created has to be created first.

Example module of a customer package $(CADDOK_BASE)/customer.plm/customer/plm/MyOfficeLink.py

#!/usr/bin/env powerscript
# -*- python -*- coding: UTF-8 -*-

from cdb import ue
from cs.documents import Document
from cs.officelink.component import OfficeLinkComponent

class MyOfficeLinkComponent(OfficeLinkComponent):

    def on_document_created(self, ctx):
        ctx.log("MyOfficeLinkComponent.on_document_created: -start-")

        if ctx.interface_host == "Outlook":
            cdb_object_id = ctx.object["cdb_object_id"]
            doc = Document.ByKeys(cdb_object_id=cdb_object_id)
            doc.ChangeState(200)

        # Example error (displayed in interface gui):
        # raise Exception("Invalid operation")  # or ue.Exception#

        ctx.log("MyOfficeLinkComponent.on_document_created: -stop-")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    ue.run(MyOfficeLinkComponent)
